seed_payload.research_question: Does seed quality affect crash payload characteristics?
seed_payload.hypothesis: Better seeds → more complex crash payloads
seed_payload.key_insight: Best seed corpus achieves 22.6% more crashes. Crash payloads average 39.2 bytes, suggesting moderate exploitation patterns.
seed_payload.implication: Seed corpus quality influences both crash discovery rate and crash complexity

mutation_repro.research_question: Do complex mutation strategies increase variance?
mutation_repro.key_insight: Surprisingly, complex mutations (CV=12.6%) show similar variance to simple mutations (CV=13.6%), indicating good reproducibility across all mutation strategies.
mutation_repro.implication: Mutation complexity does not significantly impact reproducibility

ttfc_crashes.research_question: Does faster TTFC correlate with higher final crash count?
ttfc_crashes.key_insight: Strong negative correlation (r=-0.99): configurations with faster TTFC (3.9s) discover 59 crashes vs 47 for slow TTFC (12.5s). Early success predicts overall effectiveness.
ttfc_crashes.implication: Early crash discovery is a strong predictor of overall fuzzing effectiveness

coverage_efficiency.research_question: Is there a tradeoff between coverage and crash discovery?
coverage_efficiency.hypothesis: High coverage → lower crash efficiency (tradeoff exists)
coverage_efficiency.key_insight: Strong positive correlation (r=0.98): operators with high coverage (havoc: 545) also show high efficiency (havoc: 1.14 crashes/1k). No inherent tradeoff; can optimize both simultaneously.
coverage_efficiency.implication: Coverage and efficiency can be optimized simultaneously; no inherent tradeoff

novel_contributions.finding: Seed Quality Impact on Payload Complexity
novel_contributions.key_result: Best seed corpus achieves 22.6% more crashes. Crash payloads average 39.2 bytes, suggesting moderate exploitation patterns.
Surprisingly, complex mutations (CV=12.6%) show similar variance to simple mutations (CV=13.6%), indicating good reproducibility across all mutation strategies.

novel_contributions.finding: TTFC as Predictor of Overall Effectiveness
novel_contributions.key_result: Strong negative correlation (r=-0.99): configurations with faster TTFC (3.9s) discover 59 crashes vs 47 for slow TTFC (12.5s). Early success predicts overall effectiveness.
Strong positive correlation (r=0.98): operators with high coverage (havoc: 545) also show high efficiency (havoc: 1.14 crashes/1k). No inherent tradeoff; can optimize both simultaneously.

research_implications: Seed corpus quality affects both crash rate and payload sophistication
Complex mutation strategies maintain good reproducibility
Early crash discovery (TTFC) is a strong predictor of campaign effectiveness
Coverage and efficiency can be optimized simultaneously in well-designed strategies
